messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
I'm at 6969 East Main. My son just shot his wife, two houses to the south of me.
He shot his wife?
That's what I'm telling you.
Okay, and two houses to the south, how do you know this?
My sons were just here. What's the matter, son?
What is your name, sir?
You've got to get here. My son just shot his wife.
Okay, okay. Is she dead?
I'm at 6969 East Main. My son's here right now.
Okay, what house is his wife at?
Two houses south.
Do you know the address?
No, I do not.
All right. Is your name Sherman?
Yes.
Sherman Kovac?
Yes.
Okay. Are you calling from 6969 East Main?
Yes, that's correct.
Sir, I have people en route, okay? I've got help on the way. Now, I need to get some information from you, sir.
Okay.
What is your son's name?
John Kovac.
What is his first name?
John, J-O-H-N.
And how old is he?
Does he still have the weapon with him?
I do not know that. He doesn't have it on him. I can see him.
Okay. Are you in contact with him?
Sir, just stay on the line with me.
Sir, I need you to stay on the line. Don't hang up.
Get over here.
Okay, okay. All right, I'm still with you. What is he wearing?
He's wearing a black t-shirt with camo shorts.
White male or black male?
White male.
Black t-shirt, camo shorts. Where is the victim?
They hated her. Can you get here?
Sir, I have several units en route, okay? You have to bear with me. I just need to get some information from you. Where's John?
He's inside. He does not have a gun.
Is he being violent towards you?
No.
Do you think this was accidental?
I don't know if it was accidental.
Is that him in the background?
Yes.
Is he crying in the background?
Yes.
I wish he had come to me.
Can you ask her if she's dead?
You have to figure that out. You can't ask him that. Too much trauma.
Okay, I understand. Where is he now?
I have him in my arms.
Hello?
John, is this John?
Yes, I just shot my wife.
Was this deliberate, John, or did you accidentally shoot her?
I don't know. She was screaming at me.
Okay.
She screamed at my kids over a boiled pot.
I'm on the phone with him right now.
John, I need you to stay calm. Is anyone else hurt?
My kids are present. I will come out. I'm unarmed.
Okay. John, I need you to walk outside with your hands in the air.
Okay, not a problem. Dad, take the phone. They need you outside.
Is he heading outside now, sir?
The cops are here.
Okay, sir. All right.
I can't hear you.
I know, sir. Hang on one second.
Mr. Kovac, I'm going to hang up now. Stay in the house. Officers will talk to you shortly.
Thank you.
Good luck. Bye-bye.
